Definition: description

Value syntax: [Oil Reservoir|Gas Reservoir|Oil Sand|Coalbed|Shale|Tight Oil Reservoir|Tight Gas Reservoir|other]
Definition: Main Hydrocarbon Resource type. The term "Hydrocarbon Resource" HCR defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation. This term should not be confused with the Hydrocarbon Occurrence term which also includes hydrocarbon-rich environments with currently limited commercial interest such as seeps, outcrops, gas hydrates etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
The day of the week when sampling occurred
The relative location of the door in the room
The material the door is composed of
The buildings architectural drawings; if design is chosen, indicate phase-conceptual, schematic, design development, and construction documents
The orientation of the exterior wall
The quadrant position of the sampling room within the building
The position of the room within the building
The building specifications. If design is chosen, indicate phase: conceptual, schematic, design development, construction documents
The relative location of the wall within the room
The physical condition of the ceiling at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas
The type of ceiling according to the ceiling's appearance or construction
The phsical condition of the door
The type of movement of the door
The type of door material
The types of furniture present in the sampled room
Hydrocarbon resource main lithology (Additional information: http://petrowiki.org/Lithology_and_rock_type_determination). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
Sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g. pistillate, staminate, monoecieous, hermaphrodite.

Value syntax: [attic|bathroom|closet|conference room|elevator|examining room|hallway|kitchen|mail room|private office|open office|stairwell|,restroom|lobby|vestibule|mechanical or electrical room|data center|laboratory_wet|laboratory_dry|gymnasium|natatorium|auditorium|lockers|cafe|warehouse]
Definition: The main purpose or activity of the sampling room. A room is any distinguishable space within a structure

Aerospace structures typically consist of thin plates with stiffeners for the external surfaces, bulkheads and frames to support the shape and fasteners such as welds, rivets, screws and bolts to hold the components together
An architectural structure is a human-made, free-standing, immobile outdoor construction

Value syntax: [building information model|commissioning report|complaint logs|contract administration|cost estimate|janitorial schedules or logs|maintenance plans|schedule|sections|shop drawings|submittals|ventilation system|windows]
Definition: The building design, construction and operation documents
The construction format of the ceiling
The physical condition of the floor at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas
The handidness of the individual sampled

Application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light
mechanical structure: a moving structure
The seasons the space is occupied
Source rock depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
The relative location of the window within the room
The type of material used to finish a window
Any result of a bacterial culture experiment reported as a binary assessment such as positive/negative, active/inactive.
The direction the door opens

Value syntax: [particulate air filter|chemical air filter|low-MERV pleated media|HEPA|electrostatic|gas-phase or ultraviolet air treatments]
Definition: A device which removes solid particulates or airborne molecular contaminants
Geological age of source rock (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
Stage of tide
The physical condition of the window at the time of sampling
The type of windows

Value syntax: [crows feet|crows-foot stomp|double skip|hawk and trowel|knockdown|popcorn|orange peel|rosebud stomp|Santa-Fe texture|skip trowel|smooth|stomp knockdown|swirl]
Definition: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a ceiling surface
Geological age of hydrocarbon resource (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
A distinguishable space within a structure, the purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used

Value syntax: [edge of car|center of car|under a seat]
Definition: The sampling location within the train car
The condition of the room at the time of sampling
Name of sample sub-type. For example if "sample type" is "Produced Water" then subtype could be "Oil Phase" or "Water Phase". If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
Degree of water held on a sampled surface.  If present, user can state the degree of water held on surface (intermittent moisture, submerged). If no surface moisture is present indicate not present.
The weather on the sampling day
Lithology of source rock (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

Value syntax: [crows feet|crows-foot stomp||double skip|hawk and trowel|knockdown|popcorn|orange peel|rosebud stomp|Santa-Fe texture|skip trowel|smooth|stomp knockdown|swirl]
Definition: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a wall surface
Dominant hand of the subject
Establishment details about the type of facility where the sample was taken. This is independent of the specific product(s) within the facility.
The physical condition of the wall at the time of sampling; photos or video preferred; use drawings to indicate location of damaged areas

Value syntax: [north corner|south corner|west corner|east corner|northeast corner|northwest corner|southeast corner|southwest corner|center]
Definition: The horizontal sampling position in the room relative to architectural elements
Information about the sediment type based on major constituents

Origin of kerogen. Type I: Algal (aquatic), Type II: planktonic and soft plant material (aquatic or terrestrial), Type III: terrestrial woody/ fibrous plant material (terrestrial), Type IV: oxidized recycled woody debris (terrestrial) (additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerogen). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
Contaminant identified on surface
Defines whether the windows were open or closed during environmental testing
The composite type of the door

Value syntax: [bettened and ledged|battened|ledged and braced|battened|ledged and framed|battened|ledged, braced and frame|framed and paneled|glashed or sash|flush|louvered|wire gauged]
Definition: The type of wood door
Drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system
A firebox with chimney

Value syntax: [radiant system|heat pump|forced air system|steam forced heat|wood stove]
Definition: Methods of conditioning or heating a room or building
The type of documentation of occupancy
List of rooms connected to the sampling room by a doorway
Stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g. inoculation, penetration, infection, growth and reproduction, dissemination of pathogen.

Value syntax: [south station above ground|south station underground|south station amtrak|forest hills|riverside]
Definition: The train station collection location
The train stop collection location
The characterization of the location of the built structure as high or low human density
The type of material used to finish a ceiling

Value syntax: [presence of mold visible|no presence of mold visible]
Definition: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the ceiling
The type of metal door

Value syntax: [presence of mold visible|no presence of mold visible]
Definition: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a door

Value syntax: [drum and drain|manual spinner|rinsed with sanitizer solution|rinsed with water|scrubbed with brush|scrubbed with hand|soaking]
Definition: The process of cleaning food to separate other environmental materials from the food source. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Value syntax: [cheeses-other than hard cheeses|cucumbers|crustaceans|finfish-including smoked finfish|fruits and vegetables-fresh cut|herbs-fresh|leafy greens-including fresh cut leafy greens|melons|mollusks-bivalves|nut butter|peppers|ready to eat deli salads|sprouts|tomatoes|tropical tree fruits|shell eggs]
Definition: The FDA is proposing to establish additional traceability recordkeeping requirements (beyond what is already required in existing regulations) for persons who manufacture, process, pack, or hold foods the Agency has designated for inclusion on the Food Traceability List. The Food Traceability List (FTL) identifies the foods for which the additional traceability records described in the proposed rule would be required. The term “Food Traceability List” (FTL) refers not only to the foods specifically listed (https://www.fda.gov/media/142303/download), but also to any foods that contain listed foods as ingredients.
The gender type of the restroom
Type of host dependence for the symbiotic host organism to its host.
Customary or normal state of the space

Value syntax: [frame construction|joisted masonry|light noncombustible|masonry noncombustible|modified fire resistive|fire resistive]
Definition: The building class of the wall defined by the composition of the building elements and fire-resistance rating.
The material utilized to finish the outer most layer of the wall

Value syntax: [presence of mold visible|no presence of mold visible]
Definition: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a wall
The type of water feature present within the building being sampled
The vertical position of the window on the wall
The primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used
A location (geography) where a building is set

Value syntax: [mold odor|wet floor|water stains|wall discoloration|floor discoloration|ceiling discoloration|peeling paint or wallpaper|bulging walls|condensation]
Definition: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew in a room
Level of specificity of symbiont-host interaction: e.g. generalist (symbiont able to establish associations with distantly related hosts) or species-specific.
Cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

Value syntax: [active surveillance in response to an outbreak|active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak|farm sample|market sample|other]
Definition: Reason for the sample
The horizontal position of the window on the wall
The compass direction the exterior window of the room is facing
Source of water used on the farm for irrigation of crops or watering of livestock.

The localization of the symbiotic host organism within the host from which it was sampled: e.g. intracellular if the symbiotic host organism is localized within the cells or extracellular if the symbiotic host organism is localized outside of cells.
The process through which the symbiotic host organism entered the host from which it was sampled.
Plant reproductive part used in the field during planting to start the crop.
The substructure or under building is that largely hidden section of the building which is built off the foundations to the ground floor level
Type of biological interaction established between the symbiotic host organism being sampled and its respective host

Value syntax: [presence of mold visible|no presence of mold visible]
Definition: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the window.
Unusual weather events that may have affected microbial populations. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, listed in reverse chronological order.

Description of path taken by the symbiotic host organism being sampled in order to establish a symbiotic relationship with the host (with which it was observed at the time of sampling) via a mode of transmission (specified in mode_transmission).
Sampling point on the asset were sample was collected (e.g. Wellhead, storage tank, separator, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
The condition of the sample location at the time of sampling.
The location of the shading device in relation to the built structure

Value syntax: [clay|clay loam|loam|loamy sand|sand|sandy clay|sandy clay loam|sandy loam|silt|silty clay|silty clay loam|silt loam]
Definition: One of the 12 soil texture classes use to describe soil texture based on the relative proportion of different grain sizes  of mineral particles [sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um)] in a soil.
Role of the host in the life cycle of the symbiotic organism.
Specification of urine collection method
The method by which the heat is delivered through the system
Conatiner in which the sample was stored during transport. Indicate the location name.

Value syntax: [presence of mold visible|no presence of mold visible]
Definition: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the shading device
The physical condition of the shading device at the time of sampling

Value syntax: [bahama shutters|exterior roll blind|gambrel awning|hood awning|porchroller awning|sarasota shutters|slatted aluminum|solid aluminum awning|sun screen|tree|trellis|venetian awning]
Definition: The type of shading device

Package item: symbiotic host organism life cycle type
Expected value: type of life cycle of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)
Definition: Type of life cycle of the symbiotic host species (the thing being sampled). Simple life cycles occur within a single host, complex ones within multiple different hosts over the course of their normal life cycle.
The surface treatment of interior wall
Other users sharing access to the same water source. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

Preferred unit: gram per gram, kilogram per kilogram, kilogram, pound
Definition: Actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture

Package item: secondary and tertiary recovery methods and start date
Value syntax: [Water Injection|Dump Flood|Gas Injection|Wag Immiscible Injection|Polymer Addition|Surfactant Addition|Not Applicable|other];{timestamp}
Definition: Additional (i.e. Secondary, tertiary, etc.) recovery methods deployed for increase of hydrocarbon recovery from resource and start date for each one of them. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
Information that doesn't fit anywhere else. Can also be used to propose new entries for fields with controlled vocabulary
The street name and building number where the sampling occurred.
List of rooms (room number, room name) immediately adjacent to the sampling room

Description of the environmental system or features that are adjacent to the sampling site. This field accepts terms under ecosystem (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001110) and human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications

Expected value: enumeration;obstruction type; distance from sampling device
Definition: Presence of objects in the area that would influence or impede air flow through the air filter.

Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include different temperature regimens
Aluminum saturation (esp. For tropical soils)
Reference or method used in determining Al saturation

Preferred unit: milliequivalent per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate
Method used for alkalinity measurement
Measurement of aminopeptidase activity

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of ammonium in the sample
Specification of the color of the amniotic fluid sample
The unit of illuminance and luminous emittance, measuring luminous flux per unit area

Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to livestock. This field accepts termed listed under water delivery equipment (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001653). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
The name(s) (generic or brand) of the antimicrobial(s) given to the food animal within the last 30 days.
The duration of time (days) that the antimicrobial was administered to the food animal.
The frequency per day that the antimicrobial was adminstered to the food animal.

Package item: food animal antimicrobial route of administration
Definition: The route by which the antimicrobial is adminstered into the body of the food animal.
The prescribed intended use of or the condition treated by the antimicrobial given to the food animal by any route of administration.

Body condition scoring is a production management tool used to evaluate overall health and nutritional needs of a food animal. Because there are different scoring systems, this field is restricted to three categories.

If the isolate is from a food animal, the type of diet eaten by the food animal.  Please list the main food staple and the setting, if appropriate.  For a list of acceptable animal feed terms or categories, please see http://www.feedipedia.org.  Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes |Food product for animal covers foods intended for consumption by domesticated animals. Consult http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997. If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes. If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food product type.
The number of food animals of the same species that are maintained together as a unit, i.e. a herd or flock.
Description of the housing system of the livestock. This field accepts terms listed under terrestrial management housing system (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001605).

Identification of animals intruding on the sample or sample site including invertebrates (such as pests or pollinators) and vertebrates (such as wildlife or domesticated animals). This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
The sex and reproductive status of the food animal.
The average of all annual precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.
Mean annual temperature

Expected value: antibiotic name;antibiotic amount;treatment interval and duration
Definition: Information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple antibiotic regimens
API gravity is a measure of how heavy or light a petroleum liquid is compared to water (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/API_gravity) (e.g. 31.1¬∞ API)
The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)

Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)

Package item: duration of association with the host
Definition: Time spent in host of the symbiotic organism at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on symbiotic organism and study.
Measurement of atmospheric data; can include multiple data
The average of dew point measures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day
Daily average occupancy of room. Indicate the number of person(s) daily occupying the sampling room.
The average of temperatures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day

Preferred unit: milligram per cubic meter per day
Definition: Bacterial production in the water column measured by isotope uptake

Preferred unit: milligram per cubic meter per day, micromole oxygen per liter per hour
Definition: Measurement of bacterial respiration in the water column

Preferred unit: colony forming units per milliliter; colony forming units per gram of dry weight
Definition: Number of bacteria in sample, as defined by bacteria density (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0000043).
Force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface
Name of the basin (e.g. Campos)
The number of bathrooms in the building
The number of bedrooms in the building

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of benzene in the sample
Amount of dissolved oxygen needed by aerobic biological organisms in a body of water to break down organic material present in a given water sample at certain temperature over a specific time period
List of biocides (commercial name of product and supplier) and date of administration
Method of biocide administration (dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between last biociding and sampling) (e.g. 150 mg/l; weekly; 4 hr; 3 days)

Expected value: commercial name of biocide, active ingredient in biocide or class of biocide
Definition: Substance intended for preventing, neutralizing, destroying, repelling, or mitigating the effects of any pest or microorganism; that inhibits the growth, reproduction, and activity of organisms, including fungal cells; decreases the number of fungi or pests present; deters microbial growth and degradation of other ingredients in the formulation. Indicate the biocide used on the location where the sample was taken. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. Microbial, total. Can include multiple measurements
Specification of birth control medication used

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, microgram per gram
Definition: Concentration of bishomohopanol

History of blood disorders; can include multiple disorders.  The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, hematopoietic system disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:74).
Resting diastolic blood pressure, measured as mm mercury
Resting systolic blood pressure, measured as mm mercury
Concentration of bromide
The age of the built structure since construction
A physical structure that is a body or assemblage of bodies in space to form a system capable of supporting loads

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, micromole per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of calcium in the sample

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, parts per million
Definition: Carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, parts per million
Definition: Carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
The area of the ceiling space within the room

The ability of the ceiling to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. Generally this means concrete that is exposed. A metal deck that supports a concrete slab will act thermally as long as it is exposed to room air flow

Expected value: mutagen name;mutagen amount;treatment interval and duration
Definition: Treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mutagen regimens
A measure of the capacity of water to consume oxygen during the decomposition of organic matter and the oxidation of inorganic chemicals such as ammonia and nitrite
Method of chemical administration(dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between administration and sampling) (e.g. 50 mg/l; twice a week; 1 hr; 0 days)

List of chemical compounds administered upstream the sampling location where sampling occurred (e.g. Glycols, H2S scavenger, corrosion and scale inhibitors, demulsifiers, and other production chemicals etc.). The commercial name of the product and name of the supplier should be provided. The date of administration should also be included

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of chloride in the sample

Preferred unit: milligram per cubic meter, microgram per liter
Definition: Concentration of chlorophyll

Text or terms that describe the geographic feature where the food sample was obtained by the researcher. This field accepts selected terms listed under the following ontologies: anthropogenic geographic feature (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000002), for example agricultural fairground [ENVO:01000986]; garden [ENVO:00000011} or any of its subclasses; market [ENVO:01000987]; water well [ENVO:01000002]; or human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070).
The storage duration of the food commodity by the consumer, prior to onset of illness or sample collection.  Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.
Temperature at which food commodity was stored by the consumer, prior to onset of illness or sample collection.
The date a food product was purchased by consumer.
The quantity of food purchased by consumer.
The cooling system identifier
Amount of crop produced per unit or area of land.
Taxonomic information about the cultured organism(s).

Name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium; can be the name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium, e.g. Murashige and Skoog medium. If the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors.

Expected value: NCIT:C14250 or NCBI taxid or culture independent
Definition: The target microbial analyte in terms of investigation scope. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy.

Value syntax: [cities|farmstead|industrial areas|roads/railroads|rock|sand|gravel|mudflats|salt flats|badlands|permanent snow or ice|saline seeps|mines/quarries|oil waste areas|small grains|row crops|vegetable crops|horticultural plants (e.g. tulips)|marshlands (grass,sedges,rushes)|tundra (mosses,lichens)|rangeland|pastureland (grasslands used for livestock grazing)|hayland|meadows (grasses,alfalfa,fescue,bromegrass,timothy)|shrub land (e.g. mesquite,sage-brush,creosote bush,shrub oak,eucalyptus)|successional shrub land (tree saplings,hazels,sumacs,chokecherry,shrub dogwoods,blackberries)|shrub crops (blueberries,nursery ornamentals,filberts)|vine crops (grapes)|conifers (e.g. pine,spruce,fir,cypress)|hardwoods (e.g. oak,hickory,elm,aspen)|intermixed hardwood and conifers|tropical (e.g. mangrove,palms)|rainforest (evergreen forest receiving >406 cm annual rainfall)|swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water body dominated by woody plants)|crop trees (nuts,fruit,christmas trees,nursery trees)]
Definition: Present state of sample site
Vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop
Date of unusual weather events that may have affected microbial populations. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, listed in reverse chronological order.
The date of the last time it rained

Value syntax: [Continental - Alluvial|Continental - Aeolian|Continental - Fluvial|Continental - Lacustrine|Transitional - Deltaic|Transitional - Tidal|Transitional - Lagoonal|Transitional - Beach|Transitional - Lake|Marine - Shallow|Marine - Deep|Marine - Reef|Other - Evaporite|Other - Glacial|Other - Volcanic|other]
Definition: Main depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depositional_environment). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

History of dermatology disorders; can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, skin disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:37).
The temperature to which a given parcel of humid air must be cooled, at constant barometric pressure, for water vapor to condense into water.

Package item: major diet change in last six months
Definition: Specification of major diet changes in the last six months, if yes the change should be specified

These descriptors are used either for foods intended for special dietary use as defined in 21 CFR 105 or for foods that have special characteristics indicated in the name or labeling. This field accepts terms listed under dietary claim or use (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510023). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, but please consider limiting this list to the most prominent dietary claim or use.
Concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample
Concentration of dissolved hydrogen

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, micromole per liter
Definition: Concentration of dissolved inorganic nitrogen
Concentration of dissolved iron in the sample

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid

Preferred unit: micromole per kilogram, milligram per liter
Definition: Concentration of dissolved oxygen

Preferred unit: micromole per kilogram, milligram per liter
Definition: Concentration of dissolved oxygen in the oil field produced fluids as it contributes to oxgen-corrosion and microbial activity (e.g. Mic).
The size of the door
Date of most recent douche

Preferred unit: microEinstein per square meter per second, microEinstein per square centimeter per second
Definition: Visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the water column
Any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple drugs used
Percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor
The number of elevators within the built structure
Amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types

An environmental monitoring zone is a formal designation as part of an environmental monitoring program, in which areas of a food production facility are categorized, commonly as zones 1-4, based on likelihood or risk of foodborne pathogen contamination. This field accepts terms listed under food production environmental monitoring zone (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). Please add a term to indicate the environmental monitoring zone the sample was taken from.
The number of escalators within the built structure

A category of people who identify with each other, usually on the basis of presumed similarities such as a common language, ancestry, history, society, culture, nation or social treatment within their residing area. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_contemporary_ethnic_groups

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of ethylbenzene in the sample
The amount of exposed ductwork in the room
The number of exposed pipes in the room
The number of exterior doors in the built structure
Unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations
The number of times farm equipment is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a Daily basis, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.
Any chemicals that are added to the fermentation process to achieve the desired final product.
The amount of chemical added to the fermentation process.
The amount of headspace oxygen in a fermentation vessel.

The growth medium used for the fermented food fermentation process, which supplies the required nutrients.  Usually this includes a carbon and nitrogen source, water, micronutrients and chemical additives.
The pH of the fermented food fermentation process.
The relative humidity of the fermented food fermentation process.
The temperature of the fermented food fermentation process.
The time duration of the fermented food fermentation process.
The type of vessel used for containment of the fermentation.

Type of fertilizer or amendment added to the soil or water for the purpose of improving substrate health and quality for plant growth. This field accepts terms listed under agronomic fertilizer (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00002062). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order.
Date of administration of soil amendment or fertilizer. Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order.

Expected value: fertilizer name;fertilizer amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name of fertilizer, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fertilizer regimens
Name of the hydrocarbon field (e.g. Albacora)
Historical and/or physical evidence of fire
Historical and/or physical evidence of flooding
The time period since installment of the carpet or flooring
The area of the floor space within the room
The number of floors in the building, including basements and mechanical penthouse

Value syntax: [tile|wood strip or parquet|carpet|rug|laminate wood|lineoleum|vinyl composition tile|sheet vinyl|stone|bamboo|cork|terrazo|concrete|none;specify unfinished|sealed|clear finish|paint]
Definition: The floor covering type; the finished surface that is walked on
Refers to the structural elements and subfloor upon which the finish flooring is installed
The ability of the floor to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations

Preferred unit: milligram chlorophyll a per cubic meter, volts
Definition: Raw or converted fluorescence of water
Specification of foetal health status, should also include abortion

A substance or substances added to food to maintain or improve safety and freshness, to improve or maintain nutritional value, or improve taste, texture and appearance.  This field accepts terms listed under food additive (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03412972). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, but please consider limiting this list to the top 5 ingredients listed in order as on the food label.  See also, https://www.fda.gov/food/food-ingredients-packaging/overview-food-ingredients-additives-colors.
A label indication that the product contains a recognized allergen. This field accepts terms listed under dietary claim or use (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510213).

The specific container or coating materials in direct contact with the food. Multiple values can be assigned.  This field accepts terms listed under food contact surface (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03500010).

Type of container or wrapping defined by the main container material, the container form, and the material of the liner lids or ends. Also type of container or wrapping by form; prefer description by material first, then by form. This field accepts terms listed under food container or wrapping (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03490100).
The transformation of raw food by the application of heat. This field accepts terms listed under food cooking (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03450002).

In this field, please list individual ingredients for multi-component food [FOODON:00002501] and simple foods that is not captured in food_type.  Please use terms that are present in FoodOn.  Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes |, but please consider limiting this list to the top 5 ingredients listed in order as on the food label.  See also, https://www.fda.gov/food/food-ingredients-packaging/overview-food-ingredients-additives-colors.

A datum indicating that use of a food product name is regulated in some legal jurisdiction. This field accepts terms listed under food product name legal status (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530087).

A term label and term id to describe the state of the packing material and text to explain the exact condition.  This field accepts terms listed under food packing medium integrity (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530218).

The medium in which the food is packed for preservation and handling or the medium surrounding homemade foods, e.g., peaches cooked in sugar syrup. The packing medium may provide a controlled environment for the food. It may also serve to improve palatability and consumer appeal.  This includes edible packing media (e.g. fruit juice), gas other than air (e.g. carbon dioxide), vacuum packed, or packed with aerosol propellant. This field accepts terms under food packing medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03480020). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes.

The methods contributing to the prevention or retardation of microbial, enzymatic or oxidative spoilage and thus to the extension of shelf life. This field accepts terms listed under food preservation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03470107).

Package item: material of contact prior to food packaging
Definition: The material the food contacted (e.g., was processed in) prior to packaging. This field accepts terms listed under material of contact prior to food packaging (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530077). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the material of contact prior to food packaging.
Descriptors of the food production system such as wild caught, free-range, organic, free-range, industrial, dairy, beef.
Other names by which the food product is known by (e.g., regional or non-English names).

Descriptors for describing food visually or via other senses, which is useful for tasks like food inspection where little prior knowledge of how the food came to be is available. Some terms like "food (frozen)" are both a quality descriptor and the output of a process. This field accepts terms listed under food product by quality (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_00002454).

Value syntax: [best by|best if used by|freeze by||use by]; date
Definition: The date recommended for the use of the product while at peak quality, this date is not a reflection of safety unless used on infant formula this date is not a reflection of safety and is typically labeled on a food product as "best if used by," best by," "use by," or "freeze by."
The age of the food source host organim. Depending on the type of host organism, age may be more appropriate to report in days, weeks, or years.

A descriptor for the mobile machine which is used to transport food commodities along the food distribution system.  This field accepts terms listed under vehicle (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01000604). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

Used to specifically characterize a food product based on the treatment or processes applied to the product or any indexed ingredient. The processes include adding, substituting or removing components or modifying the food or component, e.g., through fermentation. Multiple values can be assigned. This fields accepts terms listed under food treatment process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03460111).
The number of times a meal is cooked per week
Amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances

History of gastrointestinal tract disorders; can include multiple disorders. History of blood disorders; can include multiple disorders.  The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, gastrointestinal system disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:77).
Specification of the gestation state
Measurement of glucosidase activity

Expected value: gravity factor value;treatment interval and duration
Definition: Information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple treatments

Type of facility where the sampled plant was grown; controlled vocabulary: growth chamber, open top chamber, glasshouse, experimental garden, field. Alternatively use Crop Ontology (CO) terms, see http://www.cropontology.org/ontology/CO_715/Crop%20Research

Expected value: growth hormone name;growth hormone amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

A liquid or gel containing nutrients, salts, and other factors formulated to support the growth of microorganisms, cells, or plants (National Cancer Institute Thesaurus).  The name of the medium used to grow the microorganism.

History of gynecological disorders; can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, female reproductive system disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:229).

Package item: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) guide food safety term
Definition: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) food safety terms; This field accepts terms listed under HACCP guide food safety term (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530221).
The total count of hallways and cooridors in the built structure
Main hydrocarbon type produced from resource (i.e. Oil, gas, condensate, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
Original formation water salinity (prior to secondary recovery e.g. Waterflooding) expressed as TDS
Original pressure of the hydrocarbon resource
Original temperature of the hydrocarbon resource
The location of heat delivery within the room
The heating system identifier
Heavy metals present in the sequenced sample and their concentrations. For multiple heavy metals and concentrations, add multiple copies of this field.
The average carpet fiber height in the indoor environment
Body mass index, calculated as weight/(height)squared
Core body temperature of the host when sample was collected
Type of diet depending on the host, for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.; can include multiple diet types
HIV status of subject, if yes HAART initiation status should also be indicated as [YES or NO]

Expected value: name of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)
Definition: Taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level.

Expected value: rank of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)
Definition: Taxonomic rank information about the host below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.
Number of symbiotic host individuals pooled at the time of collection.
Most frequent job performed by subject

Package item: observed coinfecting organisms in host of host
Definition: The taxonomic name of any coinfecting organism observed in a symbiotic relationship with the host of the sampled host organism. e.g. where a sample collected from a host trematode species (A) which was collected from a host_of_host fish (B) that was also infected with a nematode (C), the value here would be (C) the nematode {species name} or {common name}. Multiple co-infecting species may be added in a comma-separated list. For listing symbiotic organisms associated with the host (A) use the term Observed host symbiont.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host disease status
Expected value: disease name or Disease Ontology term
Definition: List of diseases with which the host of the symbiotic host organism has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host local environmental context
Expected value: UBERON term(s), multiple values can be separated by pipes.
Definition: For a symbiotic host organism the local anatomical environment within its host may have causal influences. Report the anatomical entity(s) which are in the direct environment of the symbiotic host organism being sampled and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. For example, if the symbiotic host organism being sampled is an intestinal worm, its local environmental context will be the term for intestine from UBERON (http://uberon.github.io/).

Package item: host of the symbiotic host environemental medium
Expected value: An ontology term for a material such as a tissue type or excreted substance.
Definition: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the symbiotic host organism at the time of sampling. This usually will be a tissue or substance type from the host, but may be another material if the symbiont is external to the host. We recommend using classes from the UBERON ontology, but subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483) may also be used. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. intestines, heart).MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. intestines, heart).

Package item: host of the symbiotic host family relationship
Definition: Familial relationship of the host of the symbiotic host organisms to other hosts of symbiotic host organism in the same study; can include multiple relationships.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host genotype
Definition: Observed genotype of the host of the symbiotic host organism.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host gravidity
Definition: Whether or not the host of the symbiotic host organism is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host infra-specific name
Definition: Taxonomic name information of the host of the symbiotic host organism below subspecies level.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host infra-specific rank
Definition: Taxonomic rank information about the host of the symbiotic host organism below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host common name
Definition: Common name of the host of the symbiotic host organism.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host phenotype
Expected value: phenotype of the host of the symbiotic organism; PATO
Definition: Phenotype of the host of the symbiotic host organism. For phenotypic quality ontology (PATO) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host subject id
Definition: A unique identifier by which each host of the symbiotic host organism subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #H14.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host taxon id
Expected value: NCBI taxon identifier of the host of the symbiotic taxon organism
Definition: NCBI taxon id of the host of the symbiotic host organism.

Package item: host of the symbiotic host total mass
Definition: Total mass of the host of the symbiotic host organism at collection, the unit depends on the host.
Resting pulse, measured as beats per minute

Expected value: Genetic lineage below lowest rank of NCBI taxonomy, which is subspecies, e.g. serovar, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar.
Definition: Information about the genetic distinctness of the host organism below the subspecies level e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.
Measurement of wet mass
Whether subject had hormone replacement theraphy, and if yes start date

Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

The subdivision of areas within a food production facility according to hygienic requirements. This field accepts terms listed under hygienic food production area (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). Please add a term that most accurately indicates the hygienic area your sample was taken from according to the definitions provided.
Specification of whether hysterectomy was performed
Can include multiple medication codes
Percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant

Preferred unit: mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles
The recorded value at sampling time (power density)

Food consumer type, human or animal, for which the food product is produced and marketed. This field accepts terms listed under food consumer group (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510136) or NCBI taxid.

Package item: injection water breakthrough date of specific well
Definition: Injection water breakthrough date per well following a secondary and/or tertiary recovery
Proportion of the produced fluids derived from injected water at the time of sampling. (e.g. 87%)

History of kidney disorders; can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, kidney disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:557).
The last time the floor was cleaned (swept, mopped, vacuumed)
Measurement of light intensity
Information about treatment(s) involving exposure to light, including both light intensity and quality.
Link to additional analysis results performed on the sample

History of liver disorders; can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, liver disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:409).
Soil classification based on local soil classification system

Preferred unit: mole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million, micromole per kilogram
Definition: Concentration of magnesium in the sample
Specification of the maternal health status
The maximum amount of people allowed in the indoor environment
Measurement of mean friction velocity
Measurement of mean peak friction velocity
Whether full medical history was collected
Date of most recent menstruation
Date of onset of menopause

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, parts per billion, parts per million
Definition: Methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

A culture medium used to select for, grow, and maintain prokaryotic microorganisms. Can be in either liquid (broth) or solidified (e.g. with agar) forms. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the culture medium.
Any type of microorganisms used in food production.  This field accepts terms listed under live organisms for food production (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_0344453).

Preferred unit: colony forming units per milliliter; colony forming units per gram of dry weight
Definition: Total cell count of starter culture per gram, volume or area of sample and the method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) should also be provided. (example : total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qPCR).
The amount of starter culture used to inoculate a new batch.
Information about the protocol or method used to prepare the starter inoculum.
The source from which the microbial starter culture was sourced.  If commercially supplied, list supplier.
Please include Genus species and strain ID, if known of microorganisms used in food production. For complex communities, pipes can be used to separate two or more microbes.

Preferred unit: ton, kilogram, gram per kilogram soil
Definition: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units

Expected value: mineral nutrient name;mineral nutrient amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens
Concentration of nitrogen (total)

Expected value: The name of an extraction kit
Definition: The name of the extraction kit used to recover the nucleic acid fraction of an input material is performed.
The number of samples collected during the current sampling event.
The number of pets residing in the sampled space
The number of plant(s) in the sampling space
The number of individuals currently occupying in the sampling location
Average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage
Number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space

Expected value: gene name;FWD:forward primer sequence;REV:reverse primer sequence;initial denaturation:degrees_minutes;denaturation:degrees_minutes;annealing:degrees_minutes;elongation:degrees_minutes;final elongation:degrees_minutes; total cycles
Preferred unit: number of cells per gram (or ml or cm^2)
Definition: If qpcr was used for the cell count, the target gene name, the primer sequence and the cycling conditions should also be provided. (Example: 16S rrna; FWD:ACGTAGCTATGACGT REV:GTGCTAGTCGAGTAC; initial denaturation:90C_5min; denaturation:90C_2min; annealing:52C_30 sec; elongation:72C_30 sec; 90 C for 1 min; final elongation:72C_5min; 30 cycles)
Concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc.
Depth of the original oil water contact (OWC) zone (average) (m TVDSS)

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, micromole per liter
Definition: Concentration of particulate organic nitrogen

The anatomical part of the organism being involved in food production or consumption; e.g., a carrot is the root of the plant (root vegetable). This field accepts terms listed under part of plant or animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03420116).

Particles are classified, based on their size, into six general categories:clay, silt, sand, gravel, cobbles, and boulders; should include amount of particle preceded by the name of the particle type; can include multiple values
Measure of the ability of a hydrocarbon resource to allow fluids to pass through it. (Additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permeability_(earth_sciences))

Package item: presence of pets or farm animals
Expected value: presence status;type of animal or pet
Definition: Specification of presence of pets or farm animals in the environment of subject, if yes the animals should be specified; can include multiple animals present
Concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon
Concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments
Concentration of phosphate

Preferred unit: number of photons per second per unit area
Definition: Measurement of photon flux

Measurement of photosythetic activity (i.e. leaf gas exchange / chlorophyll fluorescence emissions / reflectance / transpiration) Please also include the term method term detailing the method of activity measurement.
Reference or method used in measurement of photosythetic activity

A description of the stage of development of a plant or plant part based on maturity or ripeness. This field accepts terms listed under degree of plant maturity (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530050).
Substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

Name of plant structure the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v releases/2017-12-14) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051). If an individual flower is sampled, the sex of it can be recorded here.

Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to crops. This field accepts termed listed under irrigation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000006). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter, microgram per cubic meter
Definition: Pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of potassium in the sample

Temperature at which a liquid becomes semi solid and loses its flow characteristics. In crude oil a high¬†pour point¬†is generally associated with a high paraffin content, typically found in crude deriving from a larger proportion of plant material. (soure: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pour_point)
The process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater
Date due of pregnancy

Package item: presence of pets, animals, or insects
Definition: The type and number of animals or insects present in the sampling space.
Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres

Preferred unit: milligram per cubic meter per day, gram per square meter per day
Definition: Measurement of primary production, generally measured as isotope uptake
The process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed
Labeling claims containing descriptors such as wild caught, free-range, organic, free-range, industrial, hormone-free, antibiotic free, cage free. Can include more than one term, separated by ";"
Oil and/or gas production rates per well (e.g. 524 m3 / day)
Date of field's first production

History of pulmonary disorders; can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, lung disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:850).

Expected value: radiation type name;radiation amount;treatment interval and duration
Definition: Information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple radiation regimens

Information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

Anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage
Redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential
Partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air

Preferred unit: gram of air, kilogram of air
Definition: The recorded outside relative humidity value at the time of sampling
The name of the institution where the sample or DNA extract is held or "sample not available" if the sample was used in its entirety for analysis or otherwise not retained.
Name of the reservoir (e.g. Carapebus)

Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)
The rate at which outside air replaces indoor air in a given space
The unique details and component parts that, together, form the architecture of a distinguisahable space within a built structure
The total count of rooms in the built structure including all room types
The length, width and height of sampling room
Distance between doors (meters) in the hallway between the sampling room and adjacent rooms

Package item: rooms that share a door with sampling room
Definition: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a door with the sampling room

Package item: rooms that are on the same hallway
Definition: List of room(s) (room number, room name) located in the same hallway as sampling room

Package item: room moisture damage or mold history
Definition: The history of moisture damage or mold in the past 12 months. Number of events of moisture damage or mold observed
The net floor area of sampling room. Net area excludes wall thicknesses
Count of room occupancy at time of sampling
Volume of sampling room

Package item: rooms that share a wall with sampling room
Definition: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a wall with the sampling room
Number of windows in the room
Relevant rooting conditions such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container.
Source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose.
pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5.
Growth regulators in the culture rooting medium such as cytokinins, auxins, gybberellins, abscisic acid; e.g. 0.5¬†mg/L NAA.
Specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium; e.g. agar.
Organic supplements of the culture rooting medium, such as vitamins, amino acids, organic acids, antibiotics activated charcoal; e.g. nicotinic acid (0.5¬†mg/L).

Metal corrosion rate is the speed of metal deterioration due to environmental conditions. As environmental conditions change corrosion rates change accordingly. Therefore, long term corrosion rates are generally more informative than short term rates and for that reason they are preferred during reporting. In the case of suspected MIC, corrosion rate measurements at the time of sampling might provide insights into the involvement of certain microbial community members in MIC as well as potential microbial interplays

In non deviated well, measured depth is equal to the true vertical depth, TVD (TVD=TVDSS plus the reference or datum it refers to). In deviated wells, the MD is the length of trajectory of the borehole measured from the same reference or datum. Common datums used are ground level (GL), drilling rig floor (DF), rotary table (RT), kelly bushing (KB) and mean sea level (MSL). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
Preservative added to the sample (e.g. Rnalater, alcohol, formaldehyde, etc.). Where appropriate include volume added (e.g. Rnalater; 2 ml)

Value syntax: [active surveillance in response to an outbreak|active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak|clinical trial|cluster investigation|environmental assessment|farm sample|field trial|for cause|industry internal investigation|market sample|passive surveillance|population based studies|research|research and development] or {text}
Definition: The reason that the sample was collected.
Measurements of biologically distinct samples that show biological variation.
Repeated measurements of the same sample that show independent measures of the noise associated with the equipment and the protocols.

Method by which samples are sorted; open face filter collecting total suspended particles, prefilter to remove particles larger than X micrometers in diameter, where common values of X would be 10 and 2.5 full size sorting in a cascade impactor.

The container used to store the  sample. This field accepts terms listed under container (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C43186). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the storage device.

The liquid that is added to the sample collection device prior to sampling. If the sample is pre-hydrated, indicate the liquid media the sample is pre-hydrated with for storage purposes. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the sample storage media.
Solution within which sample was stored, if any.
The recent and long term history of outside sampling
Sample transport duration (in days or hrs) and temperature the sample was exposed to (e.g. 5.5 days; 20 ¬∞C)
The duration of time from when the sample was collected until processed. Indicate the duration for which the sample was stored written in ISO 8601 format.
Temperature at which sample was transported, e.g. -20 or 4 degree Celsius.

Expected value: measurement value or measurement value range
Definition: Depth of the sample i.e. The vertical distance between the sea level and the sampled position in the subsurface. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples e.g. 1325.75-1362.25 m
Name of the well (e.g. BXA1123) where sample was taken

Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)
Average humidity of the region throughout the growing season.
The process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage

Pre-filled, ready-to-use reagent cartridges. Used to produce improved chemistry, cluster density and read length as well as improve quality (Q) scores. Reagent components are encoded to interact with the sequencing system to validate compatibility with user-defined applications. Indicate name of the sequencing kit.
The location the sequencing run was performed. Indicate the name of the lab or core facility where samples were sequenced.

A characterization of a cell or microorganism based on the antigenic properties of the molecules on its surface. Indicate the name of a serovar or serotype of interest. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy.
Type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial
Current sexual partner and frequency of sex
The material the shading device is composed of
Concentration of silicate

The direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., nw or 315 degrees. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

Commonly called 'slope'. The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer
The time activated sludge remains in reactor
Specification of smoking status

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Sodium concentration in the sample

soil horizon is defined as the layer parallel to the soil surface whose physical, chemical and biological characteristics differ from the layers above and beneath. Horizon can be described both in absolute terms (particle size distribution for texture, for instance) and in terms relative to the surrounding material, i.e. ‘coarser’ or ‘sandier’ than the horizons above and below.
Porosity of soil or deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample.

Preferred unit: gram, microgram, mole per liter, gram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc.

Preferred unit: gram, microgram, mole per liter, gram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc.

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of soluble reactive phosphorus
Food consumer type, human or animal, for which the food product is produced and marketed. This field accepts terms listed under food consumer group (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510136).
Specification of special diet; can include multiple special diets

Preferred unit: gram of air, kilogram of air
Definition: The mass of water vapour in a unit mass of moist air, usually expressed as grams of vapour per kilogram of air, or, in air conditioning, as grains per pound.

Qualitative description of a microbial response to antimicrobial agents. Bacteria may be susceptible or resistant to a broad range of antibiotic drugs or drug classes, with several intermediate states or phases. This field accepts terms under antimicrobial phenotype (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ARO_3004299).
Antimicrobials used in research study to assess effects of exposure on microbiome of a specific site.  Please list antimicrobial, common name and/or class and concentration used for spike-in.

Preferred unit: colony forming units per milliliter; colony forming units per gram of dry weight
Definition: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) should also be provided (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qPCR).

A liquid or gel containing nutrients, salts, and other factors formulated to support the growth of microorganisms, cells, or plants (National Cancer Institute Thesaurus).  A growth medium is a culture medium which has the disposition to encourage growth of particular bacteria to the exclusion of others in the same growth environment.  In this case, list the culture medium used to propagate the spike-in bacteria during preparation of spike-in inoculum. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the spike in growth media.

Expected value: heavy metal name or chemical symbol; concentration
Definition: Heavy metals used in research study to assess effects of exposure on microbiome of a specific site.  Please list heavy metals and concentration used for spike-in.

Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s). This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Expected value: NCIT:C14250 or antigenic formula or serovar name
Definition: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the serovar or serotype level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Expected value: NCIT:C14250 or NCBI taxid or text
Definition: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the strain level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

The method used to sterilize the sampling room. This field accepts terms listed under electromagnetic radiation (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001026). If the proper descriptor is not listed, please use text to describe the sampling room sterilization method. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Expected value: YES or NO due to (1)adverse event (2) non-compliance (3) lost to follow up (4)other-specify
Definition: Specification of study completion status, if no the reason should be specified

A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution. This field accepts terms under study design (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0500000). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the study design. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
Sample incubation duration if unpublished or unvalidated method is used. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.
Sample incubation temperature if unpublished or unvalidated method is used.
For time-course research studies involving samples of the food commodity, indicate the total duration of the time-course study.

A process in which the act is intended to modify or alter some other material entity.  From the study design, each treatment is comprised of one level of one or multiple factors. This field accepts terms listed under treatment (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MCO_0000866). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the study treatment. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of sulfate in the sample
Original sulfate concentration in the hydrocarbon resource

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of sulfide in the sample
Surfaces: water activity as a function of air and material moisture

Preferred unit: parts per million, gram per cubic meter, gram per square meter
Definition: Water held on a surface
ph measurement of surface
Temperature of the surface at the time of sampling
Concentration of suspended particulate matter

Preferred unit: gram, microgram, milligram per liter, mole per liter, gram per liter, part per million
Definition: Concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter; can include multiple substances

Total Acid Number¬†(TAN) is a measurement of acidity that is determined by the amount of¬†potassium hydroxide¬†in milligrams that is needed to neutralize the acids in one gram of oil.¬†It is an important quality measurement of¬†crude oil. (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Total_acid_number)
The recorded temperature value at sampling time outside
The process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment
Specification of the time since last toothbrushing
Specification of the time since last wash
Time point at which a sample or observation is made or taken from a biomaterial as measured from some reference point. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format.
Description of plant tissue culture growth media used

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of toluene in the sample
Measurement of total depth of water column
Total dissolved nitrogen concentration, reported as nitrogen, measured by: total dissolved nitrogen = NH4 + NO3NO2 + dissolved organic nitrogen
Total inorganic nitrogen content

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, milligram per kilogram
Definition: Concentration of total iron in the sample

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, micromole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, micromole per liter
Definition: Total particulate carbon content

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Total phosphorus concentration in the sample, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of total sulfur in the sample
The subway line name

Package item: travel outside the country in last six months
Definition: Specification of the countries travelled in the last six months; can include multiple travels
Specification of twin sibling presence
Customary or normal density of occupants

History of urogenital disorders, can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, reproductive system disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:15) or urinary system disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:18).

History of urogenital tract disorders; can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, urinary system disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:18).

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of Volatile Fatty Acids in the sample
Original volatile fatty acid concentration in the hydrocarbon resource

Value syntax: [photos|videos|commonly of the building|site context (adjacent buildings, vegetation, terrain, streets)|interiors|equipment|3D scans]
Definition: The building visual media
A measure of oil's resistance¬†to gradual deformation by¬†shear stress¬†or¬†tensile stress (e.g. 3.5 cp; 100 ¬∞C)

Preferred unit: microgram per cubic meter, parts per million, nanogram per liter
Definition: Concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature; can report multiple volatile organic compounds by entering numeric values preceded by name of compound
The total area of the sampled room's walls
The average height of the walls in the sampled room
The ability of the wall to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. Generally this means concrete or concrete block that is either exposed or covered only with paint
The origin of wastewater such as human waste, rainfall, storm drains, etc.
Reference or method used in determining the water content of soil
Measurement of magnitude and direction of flow within a fluid
Current amount of water (%) in a produced fluid stream; or the average of the combined streams
The size of the water feature

Preferred unit: per day, per week, per month
Definition: Number of water delivery events within a given period of time.
Water production rates per well (e.g. 987 m3 / day)

Description of the environmental features that are adjacent to the farm water source. This field accepts terms under ecosystem (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001110) and human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Package item: weight loss in last three months
Definition: Specification of weight loss in the last three months, if yes should be further specified to include amount of weight loss

A unique identifier of a well or wellbore. This is part of the Global Framework for Well Identification initiative which is compiled by the Professional Petroleum Data Management Association (PPDM) in an effort to improve well identification systems. (Supporting information: https://ppdm.org/ and http://dl.ppdm.org/dl/690)
The type of window covering
The number of times windows are opened per week
The window's length and width

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of xylene in the sample
